title: Standard Error: Effect on $T$-Statistic and $P$-Value
question_text:
Julissa conducted a one-sample $t$-test for a population mean using a one-sided greater than hypothesis. Later, she realized that the value she had used for the standard error was incorrect and that the actual value that she should have used was higher.
Assuming everything else remains constant, what effect will the higher standard error have on the $t$-statistic and the $p$-value for the test?

choices.text:
Both the
t
-statistic and the
p
-value will remain unchanged.

Both the
t
-statistic and the
p
-value will decrease.

Both the
t
-statistic and the
p
-value will increase.

The
t
-statistic will decrease and the
p
-value will increase.

The
t
-statistic will increase and the
p
-value will decrease.
